headline.main: LETTER FROM THE POPEL.; AN "INDULGENCE" TO ALL GOOD CATHOLICS. Protestant Maladies, Fearful Earthquakes, and Other Direful Calamities to be Cured, Stopped and Prevented by the Performances of the ??.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is rendered from the authorized version, published in the French Catholic paper, L'Aime de la Religion, which is of itself a translation from the original Lavin in which the document was written:
docs.snippet: The following is rendered from the authorized version, published in the French Catholic paper, L'Aime de la Religion, which is of itself a translation from the original Lavin in which the document was written:

docs.lead_paragraph: The first article in our creed as a people is, that anything can be done. The next is, that we can certainly succeed in some way or other. Put these two sentiments together, and we have the secret of American life.
docs.snippet: The first article in our creed as a people is, that anything can be done. The next is, that we can certainly succeed in some way or other. Put these two sentiments together, and we have the secret of American life.

headline.main: EUROPEAN AFFAIRS.; General Summary of the Political News. THE MAGARA'S MAILS. Progress and Prospects of the European War. MISCELLANEOUS INTELLIGENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fortifications of Bomarsund are to be destroyed; the Aland Isles are to be evaouated! Such is the new given by the official Momteur, and I need not tell you that this resolutions signifies the failure of the "presuasive policy" in the North.
docs.snippet: The fortifications of Bomarsund are to be destroyed; the Aland Isles are to be evaouated! Such is the new given by the official Momteur, and I need not tell you that this resolutions signifies the failure of the "presuasive policy" in the North.

headline.main: THE PEACE NEGOTIATIONS.; Diplomatic Correspondence between Russia, Austria and Prussia.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the diplomatic correspondence between the various European Powers offers the only authentic record of the progress of the efforts made for the restoration of peace, we continue the publication of the successive notes as they reach us.
docs.snippet: As the diplomatic correspondence between the various European Powers offers the only authentic record of the progress of the efforts made for the restoration of peace, we continue the publication of the successive notes as they reach us.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Gallandet Monument--Meeting of Deaf-Mutes. New-York University. Things at the Newsbays' Lodging-House. The Seaman's Retreat at Clifton, S. I. CAPT. HOPKINS ACQUITTED. Hearing In the Case before Judge Beebe. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT-- THE CLARK AND DOPKINS' TROUBLE. The Wescott and Sawyer Discussion. Court of General Sessions. The Selznre of the Srenroship Ben Franklin. SUPREME COURT--

docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of Deaf-mutes on board the steamer City of Hartford, was held on Thursday evening. On motion of Mr. P. E. MOXHOUSE, of Granville, Washington County, Mr. JOHN CARLIN, artist, of this City, was called to the Chair, and Rev. THOMAS CALLAUDET was appointed Secretary.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: If supply and demand, the economist's standard of value, are to continue to regulate the rate of rents and the quality of tenements in this City, the one will quickly absorb the bulk of the worker's wages, and the other will become so wretched as to prove fatal to the bodily health and moral purity of himself and his family.
